buri.ddmsence

Class AbstractBaseComponent

  • Object
    • buri.ddmsence.AbstractBaseComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDDMSComponent
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractAccessEntity, AbstractNtkString, AbstractProducerRole, AbstractQualifierValue, AbstractRoleEntity, AbstractSimpleString, AbstractTaskingRole, AbstractTspiAddress, AbstractTspiShape, Access, ApproximableDate, BoundingBox, BoundingGeometry, Category, Dates, ExtensibleElement, FacilityIdentifier, Format, GeographicIdentifier, GeospatialCoverage, Keyword, Link, MetacardInfo, Notice, NoticeList, Point, Polygon, Position, PostalAddress, ProductionMetric, ProfileList, RecordKeeper, RecordsManagementInfo, Resource, ResourceManagement, RevisionRecall, Rights, Security, SubjectCoverage, TaskID, TaskingInfo, TemporalCoverage, VerticalExtent, VirtualCoverage

    public abstract class AbstractBaseComponent
extends Object
implements IDDMSComponent
    Top-level base class for all DDMS elements and attributes modeled as Java objects.

    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0

    Extensions of this class are generally expected to be immutable, and the underlying XOM element MUST be set before the component is used. It is assumed that after the constructor on a component has been called, the component will be well-formed and valid.

    History
    None.
    Nested Elements
    NameCardinalityAvailability
    None. Extending classes may have additional elements.
    Attributes
    NameCardinalityAvailability
    None. Extending classes may have additional attributes.
    Validation Rules
    RuleTypeApplicability
    The component has a name.Error
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0
    All child components use the same version of DDMS as this component.Error
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0
    Warnings from any child components are claimed by this component.Warning
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0
    Warnings from any security attributes are claimed by this component.Warning
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0
    Since:
    0.9.b
    Author:
    Brian Uri!

        Description copied from interface: IDDMSComponent
        Returns a list of any warning messages that occurred during validation. Warnings do not prevent a valid component from being formed. A parent component should also claim the warnings of its child elements.

        Base case for warnings. This method can be overridden for more in-depth validation. It is always assumed that the subcomponents of a component are already valid.

      • addDdms40Warning

        protected void addDdms40Warning(String component)
        Adds a warning about a component which is used in a valid manner, but may cause issues with systems that only process an earlier DDMS version with the same namespace.

        DDMS 4.0 and 4.1 share the same XML namespace, so it is impossible to tell which DDMS version is employed from the XML namespace alone. If an XML instance of a metacard employs a new DDMS 4.1 construct (like the new ntk:Access element in a ddms:metacardInfo element), that XML instance will fail to work in a DDMS 4.0 system.

        Parameters:
        component - a text description of the component that is being warned about

      • getJSONObject

        public abstract com.google.gson.JsonObject getJSONObject()
        Renders this component as a JSON object, which can either be converted to a JSON string or inserted into the parent JSON object. Although this method is marked a public, it is only intended to be used internally, and is not part of the IDDMSComponent interface. Use the toJSON() method as the public way to get JSON output.

        protected static void addJson(com.google.gson.JsonObject object,

                              Object value)
        Adds a value to a JSON object, but only if it is not empty and not null. This method delegates to Util, so the individual JSON implementations are cleaner.
        Parameters:

        name - the name of the array, if added

      • getHTMLTextOutput

        public abstract String getHTMLTextOutput(OutputFormat format,
                                         String prefix,
                                         String suffix)
        Renders this component as HTML or Text, with an optional prefix to nest it.

        I consider this to be an internal method, that unfortunately must be marked as public to allow cross-package access when generating output. Use toHTML() and toText() as the formal, public methods to generate output.

        Parameters:
        format - the desired format of this output
        prefix - an optional prefix to put on each name.
        suffix - an optional suffix to append to each name, such as an index.
        Returns:
        the representation of this component in the specified format

      • getNestedComponents

        protected List<IDDMSComponent> getNestedComponents()
        Accessor for a collection of nested components. A list such as this is useful for bulk actions, such as checking emptiness, equality, generating hash codes, or applying mass validation.

      • buildHTMLTextOutput

        public static String buildHTMLTextOutput(OutputFormat format,
                                         String name,
                                         String content)
        Convenience method to build a meta tag for HTML output or a text line for Text output.
        Parameters:
        format - the desired format of this output
        name - the name of the name-value pairing (will be escaped in HTML)
        content - the value of the name-value pairing (will be escaped in HTML)
        Returns:
        a string containing the output
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the format is not HTML or Text.

      • buildHTMLTextOutput

        protected String buildHTMLTextOutput(OutputFormat format,
                                     String prefix,
                                     List<?> contents)
        Convenience method to build a meta tag for HTML output or a text line for Text output for a list of multiple DDMS components.
        Parameters:
        format - the desired format of this output
        prefix - the first part of the name in the name-value pairing (will be escaped in HTML)
        contents - a list of the values (will be escaped in HTML)
        Returns:
        a string containing the output
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the format is not HTML or Text.

      • buildPrefix

        protected String buildPrefix(String prefix,
                             String token,
                             String suffix)
        Convenience method to construct a naming prefix for use in HTML/Text output
        Parameters:
        prefix - an optional first part to the prefix
        token - an optional second part to the prefix
        suffix - an optional third part to the prefix
        Returns:
        a String containing the concatenated values

      • buildIndex

        protected String buildIndex(int index,
                            int total)
        Constructs a braced 1-based index to differentiate multiples in HTML/Text output, based on the 0-based list index of the item, and the output.indexLevel configurable property. When this property is 0, indices are never shown. At 1, indices are shown when needed, but hidden when there is only 1 item to display. At 2, indices are always shown. If the property is set to something else, it defaults to 0.
        Parameters:
        index - the 0-based index of an item in a list
        total - the total number of items in that list
        Returns:
        a String containing the index text, if applicable

                              throws InvalidDDMSException
        Helper method to validate that a specific version of DDMS (or higher) is being used.
        Parameters:
        version - the inclusive threshold version
        Throws:
        InvalidDDMSException - if the version is not high enough

      • requireAtMostVersion

        protected void requireAtMostVersion(String version)
                             throws InvalidDDMSException
        Helper method to validate that a specific version of DDMS (or lower) is being used.
        Parameters:
        version - the inclusive threshold version
        Throws:
        InvalidDDMSException - if the version is too high enough

      • getDDMSVersion

        protected DDMSVersion getDDMSVersion()
        Returns the most recent compatible DDMSVersion for this component, based on the XML Namespace. Depends on the XOM Element being set. For DDMS versions that share the same namespace (4.0.1 and 4.1), the newer version is always returned.
        Returns:
        a version
        Throws:
        UnsupportedVersionException - if the XML namespace is not one of the supported DDMS namespaces.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Test for logical equality.

        The base case tests against the name value and namespaceURI, as well as any child components classified as "nested components" and any security attributes. Extending classes may require additional rules for equality. This case automatically includes any nested components or security attributes.

        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        See Also:
        Object.equals(Object)

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hashcode for the component.

        This automatically includes any nested components or security attributes.

        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
        See Also:
        Object.hashCode()

        Returns the XML representation of the component

      • getLocatorSuffix

        protected String getLocatorSuffix()
        Can be overridden to change the locator string used in warnings and errors.

        For components such as Format, there are wrapper elements that are not implemented as Java objects. These elements should be included in the XPath string used to identify the source of the error.

        For example, if a ddms:extent element has a warning and the ddms:format element reports it, the locator information should be "/ddms:format/ddms:Media/ddms:extent" and not the default of "/ddms:format/ddms:extent"

        Returns:
        an empty string, unless overridden.

      • addWarning

        protected void addWarning(String text)
        Convenience method to create a warning and add it to the list of validation warnings.
        Parameters:
        text - the description text

      • addWarnings

        protected void addWarnings(List<ValidationMessage> warnings,
                           boolean forAttributes)
        Convenience method to add multiple warnings to the list of validation warnings.

        Child locator information will be prefixed with the parent (this) locator information. This does not overwrite the original warning -- it creates a new copy.

        Parameters:
        warnings - the list of validation messages to add
        forAttributes - if true, the locator suffix is not used, because the attributes will be for the topmost element (for example, warnings for gml:Polygon's security attributes should not end up with a locator of /gml:Polygon/gml:exterior/gml:LinearRing).

      • getXOMElement

        protected nu.xom.Element getXOMElement()
        Accessor for the XOM element representing this component

      • setXOMElement

        protected void setXOMElement(nu.xom.Element element,
                             boolean validateNow)
                      throws InvalidDDMSException
        Accessor for the XOM element representing this component. When the element is set, the component is validated again with validate.
        Parameters:
        element - the XOM element to use
        validateNow - whether to validate the component immediately after setting
        Throws:
        InvalidDDMSException
